title: Why does music help plants grow faster? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sound also influences the opening and closing of stomata – the tiny pores that act like primitive lungs on plants. Music helps a stoma stay open for longer, thus taking in more air and growing faster. Some sound frequencies activate genes that speed up plant growth. I listen to classical music when I was spending time with my baby's plant…

I’m in tune with all the plants are grown and I play a lot of music but I’m not sure that other than wheat that has ears that a plant would hear the music or the vibration from the music. I know that when I fertilise my plants and water them properly they grow fast and especially they when they’re in sunny conditions.
